ul.li1: 1Remember, O Yahweh, what has become of us;
take note, and see our disgrace!
2Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers,
ul.li2: our houses, to foreigners.
ul.li1: 3We have become orphans, fatherless,
ul.li2: our mothers are like widows.
ul.li1: 4We pay for water with money,Literally “we drink our water by money”
ul.li2: our wood comes to us at a price.
ul.li1: 5We are driven on our necks;
ul.li2: we are weary, there is no rest for us.
ul.li1: 6We have made a deal with Egypt and Assyria
ul.li2: to be satisfied with food.
ul.li1: 7Our fathers have sinned, they are no more;
ul.li2: we bear their iniquity.
ul.li1: 8Slaves rule over us;
ul.li2: there is no one to deliver us from their hand.
ul.li1: 9We risk our life for foodLiterally “We take our food at our life”
ul.li2: because of the sword of the desert.
ul.li1: 10Our skin is hot like an oven
ul.li2: because of the scorching famine.
ul.li1: 11They raped women in Zion,
ul.li2: young womenOr “virgins” in the cities of Judah.
ul.li1: 12They hang princes by their hand;
ul.li2: they do not show respect before elders.
ul.li1: 13Young men must carry a hand-mill
ul.li2: and boys stumble under the wood.
ul.li1: 14Elders are no longer at the gate,
ul.li2: young men no longer play stringed instruments.
ul.li1: 15The joy of our hearts has stopped;
ul.li2: our circle-dancing has changed to a mourning ceremony.
ul.li1: 16The crown has fallen from our head;
ul.li2: woe to us, for we have sinned!
ul.li1: 17Because of this, our heart has become faint,
ul.li2: because of these, our eyes have become dim.
ul.li1: 18Because of Mount Zion, which lies desolate,
ul.li2: foxes tread on it.Literally “foxes go on it”
ul.li1: 19You, O Yahweh, will sit forever
ul.li2: on your throne for generation to generation.
ul.li1: 20Why have you forgotten us forever?
ul.li2: Why have you forsaken us for so long?Literally “for long days”
ul.li1: 21Restore us to you, O Yahweh, that we will be restored;
ul.li2: renew our days as of old.
ul.li1: 22Unless you have utterly rejected us,
ul.li2: unless you are angry with us beyond measure.
